measurement_outcome_ART: Self-asesment using the Self-Rating Scale Item
findings: Experiencing syndemic conditions is associated with decreased medication adherence ; PTSD and stiulant use had the strongest influence on medication adherence in the final model.

measurement_IDU: At least one episode in the past 3 months
CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
findings: Network analysis is a valuable methodology to examine patterns of synergistic relationships among psychosocial conditions that form a syndemic and may be preferable to EFA. Suicidal ideation, IDU, substance use and depression were the four most central nodes, suggesting that they may be important psychosocial syndemic indicators to investigate as well as targets of intervention

polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
measurement_outcome_exchange_sex: Being given anything (money, drugs, a place to stay, etc.) in exchange for sex in the last 3 months
findings: Exchange sex was associated with being a Black MSM, < 30 years,  annual incomes < 20.000$, recent depressive symptoms, polydrug use, stimulant use and having experienced past and present IPV

depression_scale_criteria: During the past 12 months having felt so sad or hopeless almost every day for 2 weeks in a row that the respondent stopped doing some usual activities
findings: A syndemic of victimization, sexual violence, IPV, substance use and depression  was identified in a latent profile comprising 1/8th of the sample. This profile was strongly associated with substance use at last sexual intercourse and number of partners but not with condom use.

measurement_intern_homop: Agreeing or strongly agreeing to any item of the revised Internalized Homophobia Scale (IHP-R)
intervention_type: intervention group (N=229) received a Motivational Interview-based HIV prevention intervention
intervention_goal: to reduce condomless anal intercourse by improving condom self-efficacy and by addressing co-occurring psychosocial conditions
intervention_control: ; control group (N=230) consisted of MSM receiving standard of care in another NGO)
intervention_duration: Two sessions of 30-45 min separated by at least one month
findings: This motivational interview-based intervention guided by syndemic theory was effective in improving consistent condom use and in reducing the three psychosocial conditions investigated (depression, alcohol use and internalised homophobia). Synergy was present for depression and alcool use and for depression and internalised homophobia on inconsistent condom use. Mediation analysis revealed that the intervention led to a reduction in alcool use and internalised homophobia which improved condom self-efficacy which ultimately led to an improvement in consistent condom use
High prevalence of psychiatric conditions (PTSD and depression) as well as substance use among older MSM living with HIV. These psychosocial burdens are associated with unprotected anal intercourse.

CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
measurement_housing: Unstable housing, in the past 6 months
findings: Structural barriers such as unstable housing represent greater obstacles to being aware of the existence of PrEP than psychosocial conditions. However, once PrEP has been initiated, psychosocial conditions like intimate partner violence account for a greater variance in PrEP adherence.

CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
measurement_housing: Unstable housing, in the past 6 months
findings: Network analysis is feasible for studying syndemics.  CAS and alcohol use were significantly associated as well as CSA and alcohol use, non-injection substance use and IPV. The four most central nodes were unstable housing, incarceration, CSA and CAS

CSA_scale_criteria: CTQ Sexual Abuse subscale
findings: Syndemic conditions emerge early in the lifespan and are associated with early sexual experiences. Internalizing symptoms, problematic alcohol use, CSA and marijuana use were highly prevalent and interrelated.

polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: BMSM on PrEP were most likely to suffer from IPV, engage in problematic binge drinking and polysubstance use. Synergy was found between all the syndemic conditions

measurement_STI_condition: Self-report of STI diagnosis in the past 12 months
findings: Syndemic indicators of poor physical, mental and sexual health cluster and are partly influenced by a pathogenic social context and salutogenic community assets

measurement_exchange_sex_condition: Exchange sex, as a worker or a client, in the past 12 months
findings: Having 2 or more syndemic conditions increased the number of male partners and CAS with casual partners in this sample of Latinx MSM in Philadelphia

Association between PTSD and alcohol dependence as well as between alcohol dependence and hard drug use. The number of syndemic conditions was associated with a greater number of male partners but not with inconsistent condom use

CSA_scale_criteria: Any sexual experience before 12 years old, any unwanted sexual experience between 12 years old and 16 years old or any sexual experience with an adult or someone at least 5 years older before 16 years old
findings: Depression and  use of rush popper before sexual intercourse interacted to increase the number of sexual partners. CSA and use of rush popper before sexual intercourse interacted to increase the risk of HIV infection. Neither education nor income moderated the effects of syndemic factors on sexual risks taking or HIV infection

measurement_housing: Unstable housing, in the past 6 months
measurement_HC_access: No contact with a healthcare provider, in the past 6 months
measurement_outcome_VL: > 20 HIV RNA copies/mL, assessed via laboratory confirmation
findings: Experiencing structural syndemic conditions was associated with more sexual risk behaviors, both from HIV-positive and HIV-negative participants as well as with a detectable viral load among HIV-positive participants
There was an interaction effet of recreational effect and drug use, potentiating sexual risk behaviors at baseline but not at 9 months or 18 months follow-up

polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
measurement_outcome_screening: Having been screened for HIV at least once in the past 6 months
findings: The men most at risk were more likely to test, such as the syndemic variables did not adequately explain discrepancy in HIV screening among BMSM. Synergy in preventing HIV screening was present between poly drug use, depression and binge drinking as well as between binge drinking, depression and sexual risk behaviors.

binge_episodes: At least one per week, every week
CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: Syndemic score significantly predicted serodiscordant CAS and this effect was attributable to variation in score within person during the study as well as variation of mean score between participants

CSA_scale_criteria: WSHQ-CSA
measurement_outcome_activity: (days of vigorous activity/4 + days of moderate activity/5 + days of strength building activity/2) / (1/4 + 1/5 + 1/2)
findings: Number of syndemic conditions at baseline predicted lower levels of physical activity. No synergistic interaction was found. No evidence of a moderating effect of resilience on the relationship between syndemic conditions and physical activity

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 15 years old
findings: Experiencing syndemic conditions was associated with an increase in medical visits, medical costs and odds of self-reporting a positive HIV status

depression_scale_criteria: Being on medication for depression in the last 12 months
measurement_STI_condition: Self-report of STI diagnosis in the past 12 months
measurement_tobacco: Frequent consumption (daily/regular) of tobacco in the past 12 months
measurement_outcome_suicide_period: Prior to the last 12 months, within the last 12 months or both
findings: Syndemic theory is appropriate for studying suicide ideation and attempts among MSM.  Notably, those reporting 3 syndemic conditions had 6.9 times the odds of suicide ideation and 16,29 times the odds of suicide attempts, mainly driven by anxiety and depression.

depression_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
PTSD_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
SUD_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
findings: There is an additive relationship between the number of psychiatric diagnoses and ER visits as well as condomless anal sex. No relationship was found between psychiatric diagnoses and STD. No interaction was found.

CSA_scale_criteria: Any sexual experience before 11 years old, any unwanted sexual experience between 11 years old and 17 years old or any sexual experience with someone at least 4 years older before 17 years old
findings: CSA is an important antecedent in the formation of a syndemic in black MSM in the USA

depression_scale_criteria: Being on medication for depression in the last 12 months
binge_episodes: More than one per week, every week
findings: Sexual minority men are more likely to be diagnosed with HIV and to suffer from psychosocial conditions. However, the clustering of syndemic conditions and HIV was only found for gay men, not bisexual men

CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
SUD_scale_criteria: Any symptom on the MINI 6 for SUD
findings: Cross-sectional analysis showed an indirect effect of syndemic conditions on condomless sex through lowered condom self-efficacy. However, a full longitudinal model was not supported by the data as changes in condom self-efficacy was not associated with changes in condomless sex

depression_cutoff: Having at least 5 positive items in addition to the depressed mood and/or loss of interest items
binge_episodes: At least one per week, every week
CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
measurement_outcome_ART: Creation of an adherence factor based on an EFA using the 7 items of the ACTG adherence questionnaire
findings: Participants' average syndemic score over the 12 months period predicted their non-adherence scores but not the time-specific changes in their average level. Furthermore, the effects of syndemic conditions on viral load may be mediated by non-adherence.
MSM seeking PEP in this sample were affected by a high burden of syndemic conditions. Furthermore, the number of syndemic conditions in an individual was associated with an increased HIV risk

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 16 years old
findings: There is an additive relationship between the count of syndemic conditions and condomless sex but not with syphilis. As for interaction, RERI were significant only for IPV and depression for condomless anal sex and for alcohol dependence and substance use for syphilis

polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: AUDIT scores were not associated with risky sexual behaviors. The association between polysubstance use and depression was associated with greater odds of serodiscordant condomless anal sex. 18,2% of the effect of depression on serodiscordant CAS was mediated by polysubstance use.

binge_episodes: More than one per week, every week
measurement_distress: Having talked to a healthcare provider about depression or anxiety in the past 12 months
findings: Healthcare discrimination, a cumulative count of syndemic and a cumulative count of antigay stigma were associated with syphilis diagnosis in the past 12 months. The RERI for cumulative count of syndemic conditions was not significant.  IPV and substance use were associated with syphilis, after adjusting for other syndemic conditions.

CSA_scale_criteria: CTQ Sexual Abuse subscale
SUD_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
measurement_sleep_disturbance: Score equal or greater than 8 on the Pittsburgh Sleep Quality index
bio_bio_interaction: The combined effects of HIV and methamphetamine are most detrimental for HPA axis functioning while the HPA axis is thought to play an important role in the reinforcing effects of stimulants
findings: In meth-using MSM living with HIV,  there is a disaggregation of the functional relationship between ACTH and cortisol, compared to HIV-negative, non-meth-using men

social_support_scale_criteria: Multiple Scales of Perceived Social Support
measurement_esteem: Score below 15 on the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale
measurement_subordination: Score greater than 92 on the Involuntary Subordination Questionnaire
measurement_loneliness: Score greater than 18 on the UCLA Loneliness Scale (ULS-8)
findings: Syndemic conditions are additively associated with multiple sex partners

depression_scale_criteria: Depression subscale of the Brief Symptom Inventory
CSA_scale_criteria: Any sexual experience before 13 years old with someone at least 4 years older
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: Among this sample of LMSMW, having at least 2 syndemic conditions predicted lifetime STI and condomless receptive anal sex but not condomless insertive anal sex nor condomless vaginal sex

IPV_cutoff_period: Responding yes to at least one item
CSA_scale_criteria: Having experienced unwanted sexual activity with someone older at 16 years old or younger
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: Among a U.S. national sample of MSM, the sum of syndemic conditions was associated with greater likelihood of reporting sexual risk behaviours. Furthermore, MSM living in non-urban areas were more likely to experience sexual compulsivity.

measurement_esteem: Score below 15 on the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale
measurement_loneliness: Score greater than 18 on the UCLA Loneliness Scale (ULS-8)
findings: In this sample of MSM living in China, a significant proportion of respondent had at least two syndemic conditions which was associated with higher odds of engaging in condomless anal sex

CSA_scale_criteria: CTQ Sexual Abuse subscale
polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
measurement_discrimination: Score greater than 1 on the Heterosexist Harassment, Rejection and Discrimination Scale (HHRDS)
findings: Psychosocial strengths were associated with a lesser odds of engagement in condomless anal sex, despite the presence of syndemic conditions. Psychosocial strenghts may operate in the same way as syndemic conditions but in an opposite direction.

depression_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 13 years old
polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
AUD_scale: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
measurement_discrimination: Having been subjected to physical violence or threats due to the respondent's sexual orientation in the past 6 months
findings: The study found evidence of a predictive ability of syndemic factors on sexual risk behaviors but there were no association with HIV/STI incidence.  Furthermore, Black YMSM had both the highest seroconversion rate in the sample and a lesser burden in syndemic conditons compared to White and Latino YMSM, questioning the usefulness of syndemic theory on Black MSM or the need to take into account other syndemic conditions to explain the high rates of HIV acquisition among Black MSM

polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
measurement_outcome_VL: > 50 HIV RNA copies/mL, assessed via laboratory confirmation
findings: Among MSM living with HIV, functional social support moderates the effect of syndemic conditions on viral load suppression, providing a significant protective effect

PTSD_scale_criteria: The Sexual Violence Trauma Index subscale of the TSC-40
CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
measurement_hostility: Hostility subscale of the Brief Symptoms Inventory
measurement_outcome_sexual_violence: Frequency of rape, sexual molestation and/or sexual harrassment in the past year
findings: There is a high reported frequency of sexual violence among MSM in Tijuana. Furthermore, the authors suggest a model of co-occurring psychosocial factors such as CSA, adult homophobia, depressive symptoms and hostility that increase the odds of sexual violence experiences among MSM

In this sample of Indian MSM, there was a positive relationship between the number of syndemic conditions and sexual risk taking. This relationship was moderated by resilient coping but not by social support.

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 17 years old
findings: 90% of this sample of Latino MSM reported at least one syndemic condition and having a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of CAS and multiple sexual partners

measurement_STI_condition: Laboratory-confirmed diagnosis of Chlamydia, Gonorrhea and/or Syphilis or history of STI
findings: In this sample of Latino MSM, predictors of HIV seroconversion included history of STI, condomless anal sex, Methamphetamine Use, Central American birthplace, experience of IPV and same ethnicity of last sexual partner.

depression_scale_criteria: Medical diagnosis of depression in the EMR
SUD_scale_criteria: Mention of alcohol abuse, abuse of illegal drugs and/or abuse of prescription drugs in the EMR
findings: Poorer glycemic control was associated with a detectable viral load, high triglycerides and substance use

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
findings: Experimenting syndemic conditions was associated with less engagement in HIV-related care, uptake of ART and adherence to ART among this sample of HIV positive MSM living in Latin America

depression_scale_criteria: Depression subscale of the Brief Symptom Inventory
CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
findings: The sum of syndemic conditions experienced by the partners in a couple was associated with condomless sex during first sexual intercourse and with non-disclosure of HIV status prior to first condomless anal sex

social_support_scale_criteria: Multiple Scales of Perceived Social Support
measurement_esteem: Score below 15 on the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale
measurement_subordination: Score greater than 92 on the Involuntary Subordination Questionnaire
measurement_loneliness: Score greater than 18 on the UCLA Loneliness Scale (ULS-8)
measurement_impulsivity: 75th percentile of the Eysench Impulsive Scale
findings: A higher number of syndemic conditions was associated with greater suicidal ideation among MSM, especially when the number of syndemic conditions reaches five. Among these conditions, only involuntary subordination and sexual risk taking remained significant in multivariate analysis

measurement_intern_homop: Score equal or greater than 19 on the 9-items Internalized Homophobia Scale (IHP)
findings: The number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of engaging in condomless anal sex with a stranger. This effect was more pronounced in MSM who are out to less than 50% of their acquaintances

In this population-based study of Indian MSM, the authors found empiric support to three models of interacting epidemics : synergistically interacting epidemics, serially causal epidemics and mutually causal epidemics, with the strongest support for the model of synergistically interacting epidemics

CSA_scale_criteria: Sexual abuse subscale of the Childhood Maltreatment Interview Schedule - Short Form (CMIS-SF)
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: In this sample of MSM living with HIV, the number of syndemic conditions was associated with ART adherence, having one syndemic condition was associated with inpatient medical admissions in the past year. Serodiscordant condomless anal sex was not associated with the syndemic count variable

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
findings: he number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of engaging in CAS and self-report of HIV diagnosis

polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: The number of syndemic conditions mediated the relationship between childhood physical abuse and sexual risk as well as between verbal victimization and sexual risk

depression_scale_criteria: Depression subscale of the Brief Symptom Inventory
CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 17 years old with someone at least 10 years older
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
measurement_hypersexuality: Having 4 out of 5 symptoms from section A of the HDSI and at least 1 symptom of the section B
findings: In this sample of highly sexually active MSM, sexual compulsivity and hypersexuality seemed to act as a syndemic condition associated with an increase in HIV risk rather than as a mediator of syndemic conditions on HIV risk. Furthermore, these findings provide support for a three group conceptualization of hypersexuality and sexual compulsivity (one, both or none)

design_comment: Quantitative cross-sectionnal and qualitative analysis with grounded theory
SUD_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
measurement_distress: Use of the General Mental Distress Scale
findings: Compared to White MSM, Black MSM experienced a wide range of disparities such as substance use, substance use disorder, exchange sex, unstable housing, unemployment, low educational attainment, arrest history, low social support and low satisfaction with one's living situation

polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
measurement_outcome_VL: > 50 HIV RNA copies/mL, assessed via laboratory confirmation
findings: In this longitudinal study, the sum of syndemic conditions was associated with lower ART adherence and higher viral load among MSM living with HIV. Furthermore, the effect of syndemic conditions on viral load was partially mediated by ART adherence.

polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: MSM with encounters with 4 or more partners constitute a particularly high risk subgroup of MSM,  with more condomless anal sex, polysubstance use, STI diagnosis and HIV prevalence. Furthermore, a higher count of syndemic conditions was associated with odds of participating in encounters with 4 or more partners.

binge_episodes: Having at least 4 drinks everyday or at least 6 drinks on a typical drinking day
CSA_scale_criteria: Finkelhor definition
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance, excluding stimulants
findings: In this longitudinal study, experiencing a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of HIV seroconversion over the 4-years follow-up and this effect was partially mediated by sexual risk behaviors

measurement_loneliness: Scores on the UCLA Loneliness Scale (continuous)
findings: There was an increased use of substance and sexual risk behaviors with increasing age of this cohort of YMSM. Furthermore, the relative contribution of the syndemic indicator variables on the latent constructs varied accros time while still loading onto one latent construct across the four time points

A greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with increased odds of sexual risk behaviors. Furthermore, experiences of adversity play an important role  in syndemic formation and syndemic conditions mediate the pathway from adversity to sexual risk behaviors

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 17 years old with someone at least 10 years older
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: In this study, constraining factor loadings to be equal, as it is done with summary score of syndemic conditions, significantly reduced model fit. In the other hand, a latent class analysis produced two ordinal categories of low syndemic burden and high syndemic burden, which is consistent with an underlying unidimensional syndemic stress factor

measurement_exchange_sex_condition: Having received money, gifts or valuables in exchange for sex in the past 4 months
social_support_scale_criteria: Currently not having either a close friend or family member to talk in case of personal problems
findings: A higher number of syndemic conditions was significantly associated with greater odds of condomless anal sex, a higher HIV prevalence and a higher HIV incidence

CSA_scale_criteria: WSHQ-CSA
findings: Experiencing a higher number of syndemic conditions was associated with greater odds of engaging in condomless anal sex and a higher prevalence of self-reported positive HIV status. Optimism and education buffered the relationship between syndemic conditions and self-reported HIV status but other resilience factors (connection to gay community, religiosity, Black pride and income) did not. Furthermore, none of the resilience factors buffered the relationship between syndemic conditions and sexual risk behaviors

measurement_HC_access: Perceived HIV-related stigma from healthcare providers
findings: Experiencing a higher number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of engaging in condomless anal sex and self-reported positive HIV status

depression_scale_criteria: During the past 12 months having felt so sad or hopeless almost every day for 2 weeks in a row that the respondent stopped doing some usual activities
findings: Experiences of victimization and bullying increased the syndemic burden of all youths and subsequently syndemic burden increased suicide attempts. These findings held true for young men who have sex with women (YMSW), young men who have sex with men (YMSM) and young men who have sex with men and women (YMSMW). However, these relationships were much stronger among sexual minority youths and syndemic conditions clustered with particular strength among YMSMW

depression_scale_criteria: Feeling snap and unable to snap out of it for most of the time or being in treatment for depression
SUD_scale_criteria: Thoughts of doing too much or wanting to reduce substance use
measurement_loneliness: Feeling lonely and starved for compagny most of the time
findings: Experiencing multiple anti-gay experiences was associated with syndemic conditions : a greater number of syndemic conditions was then subsequently associated with greater odds of engaging in serodiscordant condomless anal sex

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
findings: Experiencing a higher number of syndemic condition was associated with greater odds of engaging in condomless anal sex in this sample of Vietnamese male sex workers who have sex with men. This relationship was mainly driven by childhood sexual abuse and alcohol use disorder

Depressive symptoms and sexual sensation seeking were more present in MSM who engaged in condomless anal sex in the past 6 months while use of alcohol or substance or alcohol just before or during sex was not. However, this study found no evidence that depressive symptoms moderated the effect of risk perception of condomless anal sex on engaging in condomless anal sex.

measurement_outcome_exchange_sex: Being given drugs, money or gifts in exchange for sex in the last 12 onths or using drugs, money or gifts to purchase sex in the past 12 months
measurement_outcome_chemsex: Engaging in binge drinking or using methamphetamine, crack, cocaine, ecstasy or marijuana before having sex with a man in the past 3 months. Or being drunk or high at least almost all the time during sex with a man in the past 3 months
findings: Among MSMW, syndemic conditions explained 31,1% of the variance in exchange sex but only 3.6% of the variance in chemsex. Exchange sex, in turn was associated with serodiscordant condomless anal sex while chemsex alone was not. Furthermore no direct association between syndemic conditions and serodiscodant condomless anal was found

CSA_scale_criteria: Having experienced sexual abuse as a child
findings: In multivariate analysis, self-reported positive HIV status and childhood sexual abuse were associated with higher odds of reporting sex with both men and women. Furthermore recent interpartner violence, recent sexual violence and childhood sexual abuse were significantly inter-associated but were not associated with sexual risk or substance/alcohol use

measurement_tobacco: Number of cigarettes smoked daily in the past three months
findings: High prevalence of smoking was found in this sample of Chinese MSM and the level of smoking was associated with alcohol use, substance use and depressive symptoms. Furthermore, sexual risk taking was positively associated with smoking, alcohol use,  substance use and IPV

sex_comp_cutoff: Average score higher than occasionally experiencing compulsive behaviors across all 10 items
measurement_stress: Personnal 14-item 5-point Likert scale measuring stress related to various daily tasks or conditions in the past 12 months
findings: In this life-course approach of syndemic production among MSM, current forms of adversity (i.e. event discrimination, current marginalization and general life satisfaction) accounted for the largest contribution to the model while early life events also contributed significantly with childhood victimization and self-perception of failing masculinity attainment remaining significantly associated to the syndemic outcome variable after controlling for all other factors

measurement_loneliness: Scores on the UCLA Loneliness Scale (continuous)
findings: A second-order model consisting of drug use and mental health burden was associated with a first-order model for unprotected sex, both indicated by numerous variables

SUD_scale_criteria: Clinical diagnosis based on the DSM-IV
measurement_escape: Scores equal or greater than 22 on the Cognitive Escape Scale
measurement_distress: Use of the General Mental Distress Scale
findings: Serosorting among MSM living with HIV was positively associated with lower levels of cognitive escape and higher levels of two resilience factors : coping self-efficacy and positive coping skills. Among HIV-negative men, serosorting was positively associated with lower levels of cognitive escape, violence victimization and severe mental distress as well as with higher levels of coping self-efficacy and social engagements and with lower levels of negative coping skills

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 16 years old with someone at least 5 years older
polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
findings: Experiencing a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with sexual risk behaviors and HIV infection and the relationship between syndemic conditions and HIV infection seems to be partially mediated by sexual risk behaviors

measurement_stress: Personnal 14-item 5-point Likert scale measuring stress related to various daily tasks or conditions in the past 12 months
findings: Gay-related and non-gay-related victimization in school, perception of failures in masculinity, social connectedness, internalized homophobia, discrimination and life satisfaction were associated with having 2 or more syndemic conditions. Furthermore, having 3 or more syndemic conditions was associated with condomless anal sex

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 17 years old with someone at least 10 years older
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: Sexual compulsivity was significantly associated with depression and IPV in multivariate analysis, as well as with self-reported positive HIV status and serodiscordant condomless anal sex. Furthermore, experiencing a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of engaging in sexual risk behaviors and reporting a positive HIV status

YMSM who reported smoking cigarettes were more likely to use marijuana, cocaine, inhalant nitrates, ecstasy, methamphetamine, hallucinogens, Adderall/Ritalin without prescription and to use alcohol until intoxication. Furthermore, they were also more likely to ingage in sexual risk behaviors such as use of substance before or during sex

measurement_esteem: Continuous score on the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale
bio_social_interaction: Attitudes towards condom is one of the key factor contributing to condomless sex and, subsequently, HIV infection. This variable is predicted by low self-esteem, as condom use represents a self-protecting mechanism, as well as by sexual preferences, substance use, race and education. Furthermore, childhood maltreatment, particularly in the form of emotional neglect, has a negative influence on self-esteem, thus indirectly contributing to sexual risk taking.
findings: Emotional neglect in childhood and demographic factors influenced self-esteem which, in turn, along with substance use and several demographic and psychological functioning variables, influenced attitudes toward condom. This last variable predicted engagement in condomless anal and oral sex

binge_episodes: At least one per week, every week
measurement_distress: Score greater than 62 on the Global Severity Index of the BSI-18
outcome_sexual_risk_period: Past 3 months for multiple partners ; past 12 months for CAS
findings: Experiencing a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of condomless anal sex, multiple sex partners and reported positive HIV status

measurement_childhood_abuse: Self-report of childhood physical abuse and/or neglect
findings: Compared to straight men, MSM had greater odds of having experienced childhood adversity, IPV, depressive symptoms and suicidal thoughts. Furthermore experiencing a greater number of syndemic condition was associated with higher odds of engaging in sexual risk behaviors

measurement_discrimination: Scores greater than the third quartile on the HIV stigma scale
findings: Experiencing a greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with higher odds of self-reported postive HIV status but not with condomless anal sex nor number of partners

depression_scale_criteria: Being on medication for depression in the last 12 months
binge_episodes: At least one per week, every week
findings: Gay men were more likely to experiment two or more syndemic conditions compared to bisexual men and female-partnered MSM. This difference was mainly driven by higher odds of consuming party drugs and being treated for anxiety/depression. Furthermore, being single, younger than 45 years old, of Indigenous ancestry, earning less than $60,000 per year and living in an urban environment were also associated with higher odds of experimenting two or more syndemic conditions
A high burden of mental health problem was found in this sample of MSM PrEP Users. Using self-administered questionnaire was a feasible and useful strategy for screening those conditions

depression_scale_criteria: Depression subscale of the Brief Symptom Inventory
measurement_hostility: Hostility subscale of the Brief Symptoms Inventory
findings: A greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with condomless anal sex with both HIV-positive and HIV-negative partners but not with HIV status

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 18 years old
findings: In this sample of Malaysian MSM, condomless anal sex was associated with depression and chemsex while self-reported HIV status was associated with depression, suicidal risk, chemsex and a history of CSA. Furthermore, self-reported HIV status was associated with the number of syndemic conditions

Self-report of having an anxiety disorde: Self-report of having an anxiety disorder
CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 15 years old
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: In this sample of transgender MSM, syndemic conditions were associated with higher odds of engaging in condomless vaginal and/or anal sex and this association was fully moderated by social gender affirmation, suggesting similar sexual risk patterns for TMSM who have socially afirmed their gender identity as for cisgender MSM

CSA_scale_criteria: Any unwanted sexual experience before 17 years old with someone at least 10 years older
polysubstance_number: At least 3 categories of substance use
findings: A greater number of syndemic conditions was associated with positive HIV status and sexual risk behaviors

measurement_venues: Frequency of visiting gay venues to meet male sexual partners
findings: 6 clusters with diverse patterns of sexual risk taking and STI/HIV vulnerability were identified. Among these clusters, the one with the highest HIV prevalence was the oldest one, reported the most condomless anal sex and had sex the most frequently with transgender partners, women and sex workers.

measurement_ADHD: Score equal or greater than 4 on the Adult ADHD Self Report Scale
measurement_alexithymia: Score equal or greater than 52 on the Toronto Alexithymia Scale (TAS-20)
intervention_type: intervention group (N=76) received tailored feedback and help-seeking advice on mental health screening
intervention_goal: to increase help-seeking behaviors (primary endpoint) as well as reducing sexual risk behaviors and STI incidence (secondary endpoint)
intervention_control: ; control group (N=79) consisted of participants that didn't received results of their mental health screening nor tailored feedback or help-seeking advice)
findings: This syndemic-based intervention to enhance help-seeking among high-risk MSM failed to improve help-seeking behaviours, STI incidence and sexual risk. Nonetheless, the extremely high incidence of STI incidence and mental health-related problems call for other type of interventions.

measurement_intern_homop: Score equal or greater than 7 on a 7-items version of the Internalized Homophobia Scale (IHP)
measurement_discrimination: Having been subjected to sexuality and/or race-based violence in the past 6 months (threats and physical violence)
measurement_trauma: Use of the Davidson Trauma Scale
findings: Using latent transition analysis, three profiles of high-risk syndemic status with different proportions of syndemic factors and a low risk profile were identified. Moreover, social support strongly moderated the association between these profiles and substance use at 12 months in that BMSM with better social support had more chance to stay in the low risk profile or to transition from high risk to low risk.

Problematic alcohol use and cocaine use were found to be additively associated with PrEP nonadherence but no synergy were found between these two conditions. Furthermore, depression was not shown to be associated with PrEP nonadherence in this sample

measurement_trauma: Use of the Davidson Trauma Scale
findings: Different syndemic profiles were found for BMSMO and BMSMW. Furthermore BMSMO had higher STI incidence compared to BMSMW and this difference in incidence was partly mediated by high risk sexual behaviors.

polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
findings: Four classes of syndemic conditions were identified and class membership was associated with HIV risk behaviors. Notably, the MSM concurrently engaging in polysubstance use and living with HIV engaged in more HIV risk behaviors while MSM presenting higher levels of alcohol misuses demonstrated reduced HIV risk behaviors.

polysubstance_number: More than one category of substance use
findings: In this sample of BMSM engaged in sex work, there were a direct relationship between syndemic conditions and engagement in sex work as well as between engagement in sex work and past-year STI diagnosis. Furthermore, syndemic conditions were found to partially mediate the relationship between engagement in sex work and past-year STI, accounting for 64,2% of this relationship.

measurement_exchange_sex_condition: Having participated in transactional sex to acquire money, food, alcohol, drugs or a place to stay in the past year
findings: MSM with a lower socio-economical status were less likely to be aware of PrEP and experiencing multiple syndemic conditions was associated with reduced odds of using PrEP although, taken independently, these conditions were not associated with PrEP use
